text:
The province of Teramo () is a province in the Abruzzo region of Central Italy. Its capital is the city of Teramo, and the province borders the Adriatic Sea.
Geography.
Teramo is in the northeast of Abruzzo and has an area of, the third largest province in the region after the provinces of L'Aquila and Chieti. The province is bordered to the east by the Adriatic Sea, to the north by the province of Ascoli Piceno (Marche region), to the northwest by the province of Rieti (Lazio region), to the southwest by the province of L'Aquila and to the south by the province of Pescara.
The main river in the province is the Vomano, long, that flows into the Adriatic Sea.
The highest mountain in the province (and in the Abruzzo region) is Corno Grande (), with an altitude of.
Population.
There are 309,859 persons living in the province (January 2017), for a population density of inhabitants/km².
Municipalities.
The largest "comune" is Teramo, with and the smallest is Nereto, with. Two "comuni" have less than 300 inhabitantsː Fano Adriano with 288 inhabitants, and Pietracamela with 263 inhabitants.
